author: {'steamid': '76561197983770167', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1690155058}
review:
Pizza Tycoon, developed by Software 2000, is a charming and addictive simulation game that lets players fulfill their dreams of running their own pizza empire. Originally released in 1994, the game has aged gracefully, offering a unique and engaging experience that still manages to captivate players with its blend of business management and culinary creativity.

At its core, Pizza Tycoon is a tycoon-style game, challenging players to build and manage their pizza restaurants from the ground up. Aspiring entrepreneurs are tasked with selecting a location, designing the restaurant's layout, hiring staff, and crafting a menu that caters to the diverse tastes of customers. From traditional favorites to quirky and experimental combinations, the possibilities for pizza creations are limited only by the player's imagination.

The game's interface and mechanics are relatively straightforward, making it accessible to both casual and seasoned players. Navigating menus and managing various aspects of the restaurant's operations is intuitive and user-friendly. However, mastering the intricacies of managing expenses, dealing with competitors, and keeping customers satisfied presents a satisfying challenge that will keep players engaged for hours.

One of the standout features of Pizza Tycoon is the tongue-in-cheek humor and quirky characters. The game's writing and presentation add a lighthearted charm to the experience, with amusing scenarios and interactions that inject a dose of fun into the otherwise serious business of running a restaurant empire. This humorous approach helps distinguish Pizza Tycoon from other tycoon-style games of its time.

Moreover, Pizza Tycoon boasts a surprisingly deep economic system. Players must consider factors like ingredient costs, market demand, and competitor pricing when setting pizza prices and making strategic decisions. Balancing profit margins while maintaining customer satisfaction adds layers of complexity to the gameplay, making it more engaging for those who relish a challenge.

Though Pizza Tycoon's graphics and sound may appear dated by today's standards, they exude a nostalgic charm that adds to the game's overall appeal. The pixel art and catchy soundtrack transport players back to the gaming era of the '90s, evoking a sense of warmth and familiarity for those who grew up playing classic simulations.

However, despite its enduring charm, Pizza Tycoon does have some limitations. The lack of additional content or post-release updates may leave some players craving more variety or added challenges as they progress through the game. Additionally, the absence of modern quality-of-life features can be noticeable, particularly for players accustomed to the conveniences offered in contemporary simulation games.

In conclusion, Pizza Tycoon is a delightful and enduring simulation game that serves up a generous helping of nostalgia and culinary creativity. Its simple yet challenging gameplay, combined with its humor and charm, make it an engaging experience that will satisfy both fans of retro gaming and those looking for a quirky and entertaining business management adventure. For anyone with a love for pizza and a penchant for tycoon-style games, Pizza Tycoon is well worth sinking your teeth into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014756690', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1652915759}
review: This game is really interesting. I think I played it for free about 10+ years ago when I found it on the internet. I got it again here for next to nothing on Steam and tried it again, and I would have to say this one might be my least favorite of the three. I dont recall how I figured it out originally, but you basically need to download a manual to be able to make the pizzas right, which is pivotal to you being successful in the game. In other words, the mechanics of this version of game are just outdated now. For .59 on sale, it's worth it. You'll easily get a few hours out of it at least. But keep in mind it's dated and will require you to go out online and find the manual to make the recipes right. I think the later games, notably 3 are a bit better just because they are just more modern and easier to navigate.

review:
Don't get this if you don't enjoy reading rather beefy manuals as you play the game. There is no tutorial, and if you try to play this blind, it's not gonna work out for you. Otherwise, yeah it seems pretty cool. I've put like an hour in though so really this is just a first impressions, but you don't need to put in a hundred hours to be able to tell that this is a game that many people are going to be immediately turned off by due to the complete lack of in-game tutorial.

Also: lmaooooo fuckin' "pizza connection". Wadda title. 10 outta 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198011976693', 'num_games_owned': 6934, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1631492791}
review: Solo como una referencia al juego original, apoyada por la gran compañia microprose de la época... el juego es super hostil, hay que darse todo el tiempo del mundo no solo para entenderlo sino que para tratar de ver como hacer las pizzas junto al manual, y después venderlas a un precio apropiado. después de al menos unos 10 intentos, recién logré sobrevivir 6 semanas... :( este definitivamente no es un juego para quienes no saben manejar su frustración.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1630652491}
review:
系列模拟经营游戏之一
在游戏里，你需要在美国或者欧洲的一个城市中担任披萨店的店长
管理自己的披萨餐厅，参加烹饪比赛，以及研究新的披萨菜单
当然游戏里你也可以利用当地的黑手党团体来对付你的竞争对手，甚至参加一些武器、毒品交易来获得额外的收入

游戏稍有一些年代，画质上确实有些落后，另外游戏内容需要自己逐渐摸索，比较容易让人弃坑
适合收藏，如果喜欢同类游戏的话，推荐先从三代入手，年代较接近、而且还有中文

author: {'steamid': '76561199073008877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1678830353}
review:
Computer Gaming World named this the 34th worst game ever made? lol First of all, gaming mainstream media sucks. Yeah, they are terrible reviewers. IGN, Metacritic, GameSpot, all of them, I don't like or follow them. CGW is today a defunct 80s/90s magazine which I never read because I live in Brazil, but here we had similar ones which reviews sucked and they are all dead by now too. I played a lot of Pizza Tycoon back in my teenage years; I was still a toddler by its time, so I played it in the late 2000s/early 2010s along another nice old game called MadTV. Let's not be anachronistic here: in 1994, this was a great game for MS-DOS, a classic today, even a masterpiece as much as SimCity is if you ask me so. It's fun, difficult, complex, had decent graphics for MS-DOS, it's too robust for its time, just don't believe the mass media, that's it. Also, there is nothing wrong if Steam sells it as Pizza Connection by Assemble and when you start it's labelled Pizza Tycoon by MicroProse and Cybernetic. If you do a proper research, you'll find out it's the same game, but Cybernetic was the developer which originally released it in Europe with Software 2000 as Pizza Connection, MicroProse was the USA distributor that modified the name and which version was eventually spread worldwide, and Assemble is the current rights owned and used MP's version along the original title. Most of my review is a response to a popular negative comment made here, but I also gave my opinion. One issue is true, though: this Steam version is buggy and will often crash DOSBox on Linux, still got my CD anyway. Despite that, my rating goes for the game itself.
[h3][b] Rating: Great [/b][/h3]

A Computer Gaming World nomeou este o 34º pior jogo já feito? lol Primeiro de tudo, a grande mídia de jogos não presta. Sim, eles são críticos horríveis. IGN, Metacritic, GameSpot, todos eles, não gosto e nem sigo. A CGW é hoje uma revista extinta dos anos 80/90 que eu nunca li por viver no Brasil, mas aqui também haviam umas similares cujas análises eram ruins e estão todas mortas hoje também. Joguei muito Pizza Tycoon na minha adolescência; eu era ainda uma criancinha no tempo dele, então o joguei no fim dos anos 2000/início dos anos 2010 junto de outro ótimo jogo antigo chamado MadTV. Não sejamos anacrônicos aqui: em 1994, este era um grande jogo para MS-DOS, um clássico hoje, mesmo uma obra-prima tão quanto SimCity se me perguntar. É divertido, difícil, complexo, tinha gráficos decentes para o MS-DOS, muito robusto para seu tempo, apenas não acredite na grande mídia, é isto. Inclusive, não há algo errado se a Steam o vende como Pizza Connection da Assemble e quando você o inicia é definido como Pizza Tycoon da MicroProse e Cybernetic. Se fizer uma pesquisa adequada, descobrirá que se trata do mesmo jogo, mas a Cybernetic era a desenvolvedora que originalmente o lançou na Europa com a Software 2000 como Pizza Connection, a MicroProse era a distribuidora estadunidense que alterou o nome e esta versão que foi eventualmente espalhada mundialmente, e a Assemble é a atual detentora dos direitos e usou a versão da MP com o nome original. A maior parte da minha análise é uma resposta a um comentário negativo popular feito aqui, mas também dei minha opinião. Um problema é verdadeiro, no entanto: esta versão da Steam é bugada e vai fechar frequentemente o DOSBox em Linux, tenho ainda meu CD de qualquer forma. Apesar disto, minha nota vai para o jogo em si.
[h3][b] Nota: Ótimo [/b][/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561198269671479', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1616950488}
review:
While I appreciate the nostalgia factor of playing this 90s game, the fact there is no tutorial during gameplay is ridiculous. This makes it extremely confusing to navigate because the controls aren't listed in the manual online (at least not that I've seen). 
Furthermore having to look up and replicate all the pizza recipes every time you restart is tedious to say the least. 

On a technical note: The screen flashes contrast color every now an then during certain scenes; specially after the recipe judging. Not sure if this is a MacOS 10.12 issue or in general. 

This game could be used to cure some boredom but gets annoying fast do to the standard difficulty and reasons listed above.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137284043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 761, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1616525119}

author: {'steamid': '76561198436120550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4794, 'last_played': 1608912478}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1708565216}
review:
There's something immediately suspicious about this ancient game... sold on Steam as "Pizza Connection" developed and published by "Assemble Entertainment" but the title splash screen and credits have the game listed as "Pizza Tycoon" from Microprose, and the game was developed by a group called Cybernetic Corporation.   Part business tycoon and part organised crime simulator, build Pizza restaurants and try to compete legitimately or use them as a front for the mob. 

The gameplay is quite deep but the game is ancient and time has not been kind to it.  No widescreen support, low, fixed resolution and dated interface make the game unpleasant to play.  And the $8.50 price tag for abandonware is extreme and not at all acceptable.   There's newer, better tycoon games for fans of that genre, I can't recommend this. 

In 1996, this game was branded by Computer Gaming World as the 34th worst game ever made.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966641545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1565876209}
review:
Pros:

- Nice blend of restaurant management and being a criminal
- Create your own pizzas!
- Mechanics are quite straightforward, eg: Can check the potential customer base of your restaurant location before you buy and trends that affect what pizza ingredients are hated and loved
- Funny jokes and puns found throughout

Cons
- Interface is very wonky by today's standards (especially buying and selling)
- Game time passes by as you think of your pizza creations
- Can be tedious when you have multiple restaurants in the city to manage (mitigate by hiring managers and having a warehouse)
- Game can be a bit unstable (save often)

Overall the best Pizza Connection in my opinion

author: {'steamid': '76561198021422660', 'num_games_owned': 3620, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1653115096}
review:
[h1] Ещё один реликт из древнего прошлого компьютерных игр [/h1]

И даже издатель знатный - MICROPROSE. Тогда от этой конторки выходило много разных стратегий, да даже ролевые игры выходили и много чего другогого. Но по идее, этот издатель прежде всего выпускал Цивилизацию. Вот и этот менеджер экономики тоже от издателя цивки.

Но играть в это можно при очень большом приступе ностальгии. Заодно нужно купить квадратный монитори с досом для аутентичности. Я не знаю только, что эта игра в таком виде с досбоксом делает в современном стиме. Через досбокс кстати даже на линуксе запускается, но сил нет на это смотреть... Хоть и рисовка вроде такая шаржовая и я в принципе не против экономических симуляторов. Но нужно идти в ногу со временем. Покупатели не поймут... С такими архаичными поделками даже недоумеваешь... Хотя вот в подобное издание серии Strike от Electronic Arts я бы сыграл... Даже в пиксельном виде. Обожаю серию страйков. И Road Rash бы классический... Вообще жизни жестока. Либо просто жалко издателям радовать игроков знатными хитами. Сами небось в одно жало шпилятся в эти классические лицензии. Хотя по правде лежит всё это добро где-нибудь на складах в виде авторских прав - ни себе ни людям...

А в этой игре коннекшн пицца не случилось. Русского нет и вообще ничего приятного нет. Ну хотя бы поддержка линукс есть, но это не удивляет с мультиплатформенным досбоксом...

author: {'steamid': '76561197962948288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1586281821}
review: This is my absolute favourite game from my childhood. Played this game countless hours and whats not to love about making great pizzas while doing some work for the mob, compromising the competition and taking over the world and becoming the best pizza chain in the world. Pick it up on sale or pay the regular prize, anyways its a steal if you like old games with great humour!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1550362692}
review:
Tags: Tycoon&Simulator&Sim&City
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Hybrid of Diner Dash and Contructor. You must set up a pizza restaurant and attack rivals using DOS-era interface and UI conventions.

Unfortunately this game holds little to no value outside of a very small niche of nostalgia players whom would remember how to play the game and thus bypass some of the learning curve. There is nothing here that has not been done better since in the competition leaving only the somewhat charming but often small, hard to decipher graphics to redeem the experience, which is not quite enough in my case. Archiving in hidden library.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989903632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1693772622}
review:
Ja, es ist nicht das richtig Originale. 
Ja, es ist nicht Deutsch. 
Ja, alle Telefonnummern sind schon vorhanden.
Ja, es ist Pizza Tycoon und nicht Connection
Und Teufel nochmal JA, es macht RICHTIG Spaß mal wieder ein gutes altes Game zu zocken :)

Seid ihr um 30 Jahre alt und habt das damals gespielt? Kauft es euch!
Seid ihr um 20 Jahre alt und fragt euch "Bäh, was ist das denn für eine Grafik??" --> KAUFT EUCH DAS SPIEL.

Bin seit ca. einem Jahr wieder auf dem Retro-Trip und zock alle alten Games (im Bereich C64 bis SNes).
Ich brauch keine Grafik! Ich brauch Spielspaß - und davon hat PizzaConnection reichlich zu bieten

Klare Kaufempfehlung für mich :)

review:
[h1]A real gem[/h1]
I gotten this game for my 7 birthday, that was back in 1996, i'm still occasionally playing this game. I spent houdrets of hours with this game and still no regrets.
It's fun, simple and it has a great simplistic logic. Nevertheless the whole "mafia" concept adds a cool touch to the overall feeling of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064907064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1495281974}
review:
[h1]I would like to order a Pizza[/h1]

[b]Disclaimer[/b]
I played this game as it came out in 1994 so my opinion might be biased but in my defence this game aged well, more so than others.
 
[b]Overview[/b]
So you like pizza? Well many do.
Ever wondered how to manage a Pizza-Empire? Great then look no further (ok maybe the successors)

Here you start small by renting a shop where you will offer your delicious Pizzas to the customers.
The restaurant needs some furniture which you can mix and match as you like.
You will need staff to cook and serve the Pizzas and maybe some advertisement would be beneficial as well.

One of the coolest parts is to create your own Pizza which then attracts some target-group more and maybe another less.
Ever wanted to have a Pizza with a whole Lobster on top while some ants on the side? No problem your guests might even like it.

[b]Rating[/b]
7/10 for regular Gamers
8/10 for Gamers who like classic games

[b]The highlights[/b]
[list]
[*] Quite extensive economy model
[*] Many possibilities to improve your business, also some not legal ones
[*] Pizza creator
[/list]

[b]The lowlights[/b]
[list]
[*] Graphics are simple, by current standards
[*] You will need the phone a lot, the one in game :)
[/list]

[b]Multiplayer[/b]
No!

[b]Mods[/b]
No!

[b]Microtransactions/DLC[/b]
No!

[b]Summary[/b]
If you like game-classics then here you go.
You will have plenty of options to play around to see how big your chain can get.

I suck so many hours, way more than recorded here, into this game and always had a great time.


[b]Xium as curator[/b]
Please check my curator profile to find other reviews and follow if you like:
http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31700185-Swiss-Gaming-Collective-%28VR-Fl/

Edits:
Changed structure, added new sections (Multiplayer,Mods,Microtransactions) and curator-link

author: {'steamid': '76561198013092889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1684065989}
review:
Good old nostalgia. Brings back all the beautiful memories of the time i spent trying to beat this game as a kid. Got it on a sale for 3€ and it is absolutely worth it. Would not have bought it full price though - it is playable for free with a few minutes of your time to download everything you need.

Oh, and don't forget to download the "manual". It is actually a recipe book and you need at least several of the standart recipes on your menu to make your pizza restaurants work. Yea, that's copy protection the good old way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020489698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 910, 'last_played': 1657398216}
review:
This was one of the first games i played on my pc!
I am glad that we can play this in a modern os (win7 64bit mine)
I suggest you all to buy this game and play a real economy simulator game....
No other games of this kind has such in-depth simulation and management.
It is a little bit annoying that it has no tutorial,but once you learn the game mechanisms is very funny and addictive.It lets you be from pizza owner to a big chain pizzas owner and from errand boy to a mafia boss.
I suggest this game.It is a must for a gamer who doesn't care about good graphics but only for gameplay.
I am very dissapointed that since 1994 nobody has ever published a game like this and not even the publishers kept this direction to their game series. In my oppinion that's why the pizza connection 2 and 3 were failures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102896368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1558815155}
review:
This is one of my absolute favorite games from my childhood. I played this countless of hours when I was a kid, making weird pizzas, decorating lavish restaurants, and of course blowing up my competitors (and subsequently spending a lot of time in jail). But it wasn't until I played this as an adult that I figured out how advanced this game really is - and how hard it is when you play it honest (not trafficking guns). 

Even though the game is over 20 years old it's still really fun to play, and I highly recommend it - though you really need to download the original recipe book to be able to play this - if you don't recreate the basic pizzas pretty much perfectly from the book you will have an extremly hard time getting customers. (This was a sort of piracy protection back in the day, if you only copied the game and didn't have the book you couldn't really play it)
